Items.Title: Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution establishing February 4 as Rosa Parks Day to commemorate the Civil Rights leader.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a Rosa Parks Day to commemorate the Civil Rights leader.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign the Reproductive Health Act.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Women
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The 3 following Council Members formally noted their intent to vote negative on this item:  
Council Members Borelli, Diaz, and Matteo.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their intent to abstain from voting on this item:  
Council Members Deutsch and Ulrich.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Reproductive Health Act
